alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 3:31AM MST until January 05 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 10 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch today. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches at lower elevations and 5 to 10 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central and Southern Lewis and Clark County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM MST Thursday. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until Noon MST today. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 10 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southern Lewis and Clark
